flim.flim.bin_image(image, bin_factor)[source]¶

This function takes in an image and bins it’s histograms

Parameters

  • {ndarray} - image to bin (image) –

  • be a 3d array of shape(t (must) –

  • x –

  • y) –

  • {int} - pixel radius(including diagonals) of bins to create (bin_size) –

  • {ndarray} - new image with binned pixels (binned_image) –

flim.flim.estimate_and_shift_irf(decay, irf_decay, debug=False)[source]¶

Estimates shift given a decay and an IRF.

Parameters

  • decay (ndarray) – 1D array containing decay curve

  • irf_decay (ndarray) – 1D array containing IRF

  • debug (bool) – Optional flag to display intermediate calculations

Returns

  • irf_decay_shifted (ndarray) – Shifted IRF as a 1d array

  • shift (int) – value IRF was shifted by

Note

IRF and decay should not have low SNR

flim.flim.ideal_sample_phasor(f, lifetime)[source]¶

Generates a phasor for a specific lifetime at a given frequency.

Parameters

  • f (int) – laser rep rate

  • lifetime (float) – lifetime of desired single exponential sample

Returns

  • angle (float) – angle of ideal sample

  • magnitude (float) – magnitude of ideal sample

flim.flim.lifetime_image_to_rectangular_points(f, image)[source]¶

This function takes all the pixels/histograms of an image and plots them in the phasor plot

Parameters

  • f (frequency) – laser angular frequency

  • image (ndarray) – 3d array representation of image, where the axis are [t,x,y]

Returns

ImagePhasorPoints –

object holding array of points

points_g - 2d array of g coordinates points_s - 2d array of s coordinates

Return type

ndarray

flim.flim.phasor_calibration(f, lifetime, timebins, counts)[source]¶

Phasor Plot Calibration

Parameters

  • {int} (counts) –

  • {int} –

  • {int} –

  • {int} –

Returns

  • angle_offset {float} (difference in angle between known sample and actual)

  • magnitude_offset {float} (difference in magnitude between known sample and actual)

Note

If no timebins or histograms passed then returns angle and phase of lifetime passed in

flim.flim.phasor_to_rectangular_lifetimes_array(angles, magnitudes)[source]¶
Takes in two arrays of angles and magnitudes

and converts them to array of g and s points

input:

f - laser angular frequency angles - array of angles mangitudes - array of magnitudes

output
RectangularLifetimesArray - object with g and s array of lifetimes

g - array of g-coordinates(x-coordinates) s - array of s-coordinates (y-coordinates)

Gets x and y position of phasor in rectangular coordinates

Parameters

  • {float} (magnitude) –

  • {float} –

Returns

  • g {float} (x axis coordinate)

  • s {float} (y axis coordinate)

flim.flim.rectangular_to_phasor_lifetimes_array(g, s)[source]¶

Takes an array(image) of g and s points and converts them to angle and magnitude phasor arrays

Parameters

  • {float} (s) –

  • {float} –

Returns

PhasorArray object – lifetime_angles_array - array of angles for each pixel lifetime_magnitudes_array - array of magnitudes for each pixel

Return type

float

flim.flim.td_to_fd(f, timebins, counts)[source]¶

Time to frequency domain transformation

Parameters

  • {int} (f) –

  • {ndarray} (counts) –

  • {ndarray} –

Returns

  • angle {float} (angle in radians)

  • magnitude {float} (magnitude of phasor)

flim.flim.universal_semicircle_series(frequency)[source]¶

Given the frequency this function will return x and y points for plotting the universal semicircle, as well as the corresponding g and s values for common lifetimes between 0.5ns to 10ns

Parameters

{float} (frequency) –

Returns

  • x_circle (float) – x coordinates for universal semicircle

  • y_circle (float) – y coordinates for universal semicircle

  • g (float) – x coordinates for labeled lifetimes

  • s (float) – y coordinates for labeled lifetimes

  • lifetime_labels (list) – labels to be applied to the (g,s) coordinates
